projectDesc.p: The Middle English Texts Series offers a diverse and representative array of literary texts that medieval readers in the present-day British Isles would have encountered between the twelfth and sixteenth centuries. It is committed to making available both affordable print and open access editions to scholars, teachers, and students of the Western Middle Ages. In its digital publications, the series prioritizes a user-friendly interface and viewing options, multiple downloadable formats, enhanced searchability and filtering, and accessibility to the widest possible range of users.

editorialDecl.p: METS takes as its mission the creation of affordable editions that would pass scrutiny from the most demanding expert, yet would prove comprehensible, and even enticing, to someone who had never read Middle English before. This agenda dictates that METS publications offer not a critical edition reflecting all surviving manuscripts, and certainly not a diplomatic edition, but a best-text edition, informed by the notes and apparatus of earlier editions (where these exist), and by substantive variants from other manuscript witnesses. Transcriptions of Middle English texts are lightly modernized to ensure a smooth reading experience, while non-English texts preserve both the original language and a modern English translation in facing-page format. Each edition offers expert assistance with language and lexicon, providing glosses alongside the text(s), textual and explanatory notes, elucidation of unfamiliar contexts and traditions, and thematic and interpretive possibilities. All editions feature general introductions that set the edited text within its own time, place, and traditions, and link it to ancestor, congener, and successor materials. All publications contain comprehensive, current bibliographies of pertinent scholarship and criticism. House style is adapted from the Chicago Manual of Style.

div.head: The Author’s Prologue
div.ab: [fol. 1r] Religious sustir,T in as mechil as ye have desiridN and preyed me divers tymes that I wolde write yow the festisG T and the passion of oure lord Jhesu Crist,T therfore now at this tyme to folweT yowre desire, aftir myn simple conyng,G I wole writin hemG to yow, in whiche ye may usenT bothe preyeres and meditacions,T yef ytT liken yowG to folewe my lewdeG techinges.T I make it but schortli,G N for I hope myT lord the Holi Gost wole techin the ovirplusG bettir than manT [fol. 1v] can devise. And at every preiere I sette a Pater noster,G N as for the most principal preire of alle other prieris, whiche is an abcéN and formerG of alle other orisons. And also for ye schulde whan ye seie thooG wordes “Fiat voluntas tua”G N to have it deepli in mende, and alwey putte yowr wil in Godes wilN in alle yowre preyeris and desiris. Oure lord that made that preiere makith alle other preieris, for beG his graceT it is doon, and therfore of alle thing that wretin and seide,N that sownithG in to goode fromT onli be the worschepe and preysing.

And I preyeT yow hertiliG that [fol. 2r] whanne ye ben in soule presentliG with yowre spouse that is Jhesu, god and man, takith me with yow in yowre preieres. O, myn sustir, preie my lordT God the TrinitéN that for his gret bountéG and for his endeles mercy have mercy and pité on me, sinful, and make me a good woman. For ful ofte sinne and wrechidnes withdrawith my gosteli syhtG from his glorious presence, and therfore yow and othere of his special children I preie to purchace me sum grace of that benigne lord in whom al grace is in.

Fertheremore, sustir, much as aT [fol. 2v] man may se that it is not faire ne semliG for a gret lord to comyn into a foul hows, but first the hous muste be swepidN and mad fair and clene and honestli araied;G rith soG it is not fair neG semli for oure lord God to comyn in to oure soule, ne we to make us homlyG with him with famulierG speche and loving daliaunce,G yef ony spot of sinne be with inne us wilfulli, til the house of oure conscience be clene swepid be confession and maad fair be contricion, and the soule honestli arraied with meknesse and alle other gostli vertues, or ellis to stonde in [fol. 3r] good wil and desir to have alle gode vertues. And seke and preie therfore, and be the endeles mercy of oure lord God that good wilG schal been acceptid as for dede,G yef a man seke besiliG ther-aftir. And whanne we may noyt have oure confessour to be confessid whiche time as we fele us defautifeG with sinnes than must we make a general confessionN to God, the wheche general confession may be clepidG the sweping awey the filthe of oure sinnesN in a corner. And that with contricion wil be ful helpliG to us and sufficient, though we have do rith gret [fol. 3v] defautes,G til we may be confessid and assoilid;G and whan we of oure confession be confessid and assoilid, than is the filthe of oure corner clene swept awey. And therfore, my gode sustir, at the beginning of these meditacionesN and preieres with a contriyt herte and lowG spirit, a fervent wil to amende yow of alle defautis, seith thus to God in this wise for a general confession:

O holy God, miytfulG Trinité, I knowelecheG to yow that have displesid [fol. 4r] yow thorw sinne, in whiche I have fallen and sinnyd:N in pride, in wrathe,T in envie, in coveytise,G in gloteiné, in slewthe, and in lecherie.N Myne five wittisG N I have mispendidG and yowre comaundementis brokyn, and of alle thise sinnes that ye knowe me gilti, in whiche I have sinnid, in wil, word, thought, and ded, wherthorw I have offendid yow, gode lord, benigne God. I yelde me coupableG to yow, besechyng yowr mercy, and preye yow of foryevenes, and oure lady Seinte Marie and al the company of hevene. O glo|riouse [fol. 4v] Trinité, I wootG wel that for the grete multitude of sinnes and defautes that is in me I am noght worthi to come in to yowre presence to aske ony boone.G But the grete multitude of yowre mercy whiche hath noon endeN ne noumbre, that grauntid the woman of CanineeN the preiere that sche besoughte, and to many anothir also opinli han schewid yowre mercy, and noght onli for hem, but also forG alle sinful that wole forsake hereG sinnes schulde trustliG ful hope to yowre mercy. Lord, ful of pité, this makith me hardyG to preie and speke to yow, putting alwey [fol. 5r] my wil to yowre wil in al myn asking. Pater noster. Ave MariaN gratia.G

div.head: 1: Prayer for Grace
div.ab: Blisful Trinité, worchepid and thankith, glorified and magnified mote ye ever be for alle yowre holy vertues, and for alle yowre worthi names,N and for alle yowr willesG and werkis. A! goode lord, teche me and make me to thanke yow and magnifie yow in yowr festes, and mekeli to have in mende the grete dedes that ye have for al mankinde, and also the grete peines that yowr manhedG suffrede here for oure love. O Holi Trinité, in reverence and remembraunceN of yow: Pater noster. [fol. 5v] Ave Maria.

div.head: 2: The Annunciation
div.ab: I thanke and magnifie yow, God ful of myht, that ye sente yowre graciousG messageN be the aungel Gabriel to the virgine Marie. O lady, for the grete joyeN that ye hadde in the salutacion whan Gabriel yow gretteG and seide that Godis sone schulde be born of yow. Preye my lord the Trinité to foryeve me my sinnes, al be love and in love, and make me to lovyn al that he loveth and hate al that he hatith.N Pater noster.

div.head: 3: The Incarnation
div.ab: O benigne lord, I thanke and magnifie yow, that ye toke flesche and blodN of that glorious [fol. 6r] virgine Marie for manes soule redempcion. A! ladi, for the greite joyye that ye hadde at al times whanne ye, swete mayde, felt hym stereG in yowre precious wombeN knowing wel that he was verrayG Goddes sone. Preie to my lord the Trinité that he make myn soule and herte clene that I myhte fele hym stere in me be hys devine grace. Pater noster. Ave Maria gratia.

div.head: 4: The Visitation
div.ab: I thanke and magnifie yow, graciouse quene of hevene and erthe, and empresse of helle,N that wente to seinte Elizabeth yow cosineG N and tolde here goode tidinges, and sche [fol. 6v] also tolde yow here joye.N And thanne ye bothynG thankid and magnified God for his yeftisG of grace, and ye lady madin the psalme of MagnificatN at that time. O virgine, preie yowr sone, my lord hevene kyng, that he sende me alwey good cumpanie and holi comunicacionG N in whiche we may in gret reverence thanke and magnifie that Trinité for alle his beenfetes.G Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.head: 5: The Nativity
div.ab: O blisful Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yowre gloriouse birthe,N whiche was clene in al pureté, and for yowre holi innocence. [fol. 7r] O dere worthi lord, graunte me grace to have clennesse and pureté of bodi and soule. Putte awey fro myn herte alle angres,N and rancour, alle evil conseitisG and evil ymaginacions and conjectinges,G and make me mildeG T and meke, pacient and benigneG that I may vertuousli love and serve yow, Jhesu God in whom arn alle vertues. Pater noster. Ave.

div.head: 6: The Annunciation to the Shepherds
div.ab: Mercyful Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow for the song that the aungelis sungen: “Gloria in excelsis deo et in terra pax.”G N O goode lord, have mercy and pité on alle yowre creatures of this erthe whi|che [fol. 7v] is yowre wil to be preied fore. Alle rithful livers,G yeveG hem good perseveraunce, and encresG of grace and vertues; and alle sinful liveres, amende hem of here sinne and drawe hem to goodnesse. A! debonourG God Jhesu, graunte grace, pees, and unité, love and charité among al Cristene peple, and sende perfit pees in to my soule that I may pesibeliG resten in yowre bounté. Pater noster. Ave.

div.note: Gloria in excelsis deo in terra pax, “Glory to God on high and peace on earth”
rithful livers, those who live righteously

div.head: 7: Adoration of the Shepherds
div.ab: Myhtful Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow that thorw excitingG of angelis the schepherdes wentin and worchepidin yow.N O goode lord, have mercy on [fol. 8r] alle yowre schepherdes of holi chirche: the pope, and alle the cardinalis,T archibisschopes, bisschopes, prelates, and curates, and alle that any have to reule and to governe. Yeve hem grace, gloriouse lord God, so to governe here owin soulis, and also hem alle that thei have in governaunce, as most may be worchepe and plesing to yow, and profit to here soulis. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.head: 8: The Circumcision
div.ab: Jesu, ful of comforte and joye, I thanke and magnifie yow for yowre holy circumcision.N O goode lord, yong ye felt peyne. Ful yong and tendere ye were at that tyme [fol. 8v] whan ye were circumcisid, where that ye schaddenG first yowre precious blod.N A! swete Jhesu, with that precious blod and peine, clense and hele my sinful soule, and thorw yowr goodnes foryeve me alle the sinnes that I dede in my yonge age and childhood. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.head: 9: Adoration of the Magi
div.ab: Glorious Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow: worchepid and magnified be ye evirmore that the thre kynges presentid yowN with thre presentis, in whiche was gret signifiaunce.G N A! Holi Trinité, to yow I offere alle Cristen kinges and emperoures: for yowre gret pité receive hem alle in to yowre mercy, [fol. 9r] fulfilleG hem with yowr vertuesT and graunte grace so to reule hem self and here temysG as most may be most plesable to yow. O myhtful God, speciali I preie yow to kepe and love, reule and counseile oure kyng:N fulfille hym with yowre Holi Goost and yeve hym good spedG in alle his werkes, and make hym to withstonde and eschewe al that in any wise myhte displese yow. Holy God, sende hym myht and strengthe to have the victorie of all his gostli and bodily enemys, and yeve hym good lif and longe, and graunte so to loveT yow that whanne he departith from this world his soule may [fol. 9v] soone be receivid in to yowre presence, where everlasting lif is and blisse. O swete lord, to yow I presente my soule, body, and herte, the king of al richesseG that been so freeG and large.G Make my pore yefte riche with yowr holi vertues, make it holy and good and receive it for yowre greet curteisy.G Pater noster. Ave Maria gratia.

div.head: 10: The Presentation
div.ab: Jhesu ful of benignité,G I thanke and magnifie yow that ye were on Candelmasse dayN offrid to yowre holy fadir of hevene in the temple,N where that seint Symeon receivid yow in hys armes, and made the psalme “Nunc dimittis.”G N O good lord receive alle [fol. 10r] oure preieris, wepinges, desires and longinges maade to yow, and alle oure assercionsG that we offre to yow, as ye were receivid and acceptid of God yowre fadir and of seint Symeon. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.note: Nunc dimittis, “Now you dismiss”

div.head: 11: The Flight and Return
div.ab: Gracious Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow that ye wer aftir that tyme flemidG in to Egypte;N and whanne Herodes was deed, ye werT clepidG hom ayen of God yowr fadir be his aungel.N O myhtful Trinité, whan we be flemid fro yow thorw sinne and ignoraunce, clepe us sone hom ayen to yow be wey of rithful levyng.G Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.head: 12: The Holy Family
div.ab: [fol. 10v] Merciful Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow for al the lowli service that ye, meke Jhesu, dede to my lady yowre blissid modir, and also to hym that was clepid yowre fadir Joseph. Also swete Jhesu, I yelde yow thankinges that ye were alwey to hym buxumG N and debonore. O goode lord, Holi Trinité, make me ever to be lowli and buxum to yow and to my soveraynesG for yow, in wil, word, thouyt and deede. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.head: 13: The Infancy of Jesus
div.ab: Dere worthi Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow for alle the yeres of yowre age. O goode [fol. 11r] lord, with the yeres of yowre vertuous levinge,N restore and fulfille alle the yeres that I have dispendidG in sinne, and yeve me grace hensforth to spende every yer, day and houre vertuousli,T as most may be to yow plesing. And al that fautithG in me of gostliT vertues and of wel spending of tyme, youre gracious bounté fulfille it for me. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.head: 14: The Joys of the Virgin
div.ab: O mayde and modir,N blissid lady Marie, for alle the grete joyesN that ye hadden here on erthe of youre dere beloved sone, and have now in hevene of his glorious presence. Lady, pray my lord the [fol. 11v] Trinité that have mercy on me, and make me a good woman, and graunte me grace that I may alwey be more preysableG to the siht of hym than to the siht of the peple, in reverence and remembrance, lady, of alle youre joyes. Pater noster. Ave Maria gratia.

div.head: 15: The Finding in the Temple
div.ab: Mihtful Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow that ye tauhte in the temple the maystresN of the Phariseis in youre yonge age that thei alle wondredeG of youre wit and wisdom, for that tyme, blissid Jhesu, ye were but twelve yer old. O goode lorde ful of grace, I preie yow with my pore herte that ye yeve hem alle grace [fol. 12r] of wit and wisdom that prechin and thechinG youre word, and fulfille hem so with the goodnes of youre Holi Gost that hereG wordes mowenG vertuousli entren in to the soules that herethT it, where thorw thei mowen hate synne and eschewe it, and yeve hem to good lif. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.head: 16: The Sorrows of Mary
div.ab: A, goode lady, gloriouse virgine, than was youre herte ful woo and sorweful whan ye hadde lost youre dere swete soneN three dayes, and cowdenG not finde hym. O lady, for that sorwe, and for the grete sorwisN and compassion that ye haddenT of al the woo and peynysG [fol. 12v] that he in this wrechid world suffrid: have pité, lady, and compassion of alle that stonden in tribulacion and temptacions. And preie my lord the Trinité, in whom is al myht and power, to do what he wole in hevene, erthe and helle, that for his endeles mercy sende hem alleggeaunceG of peynes and grace of victorie that thei be not overcome in here temptacions and tribulacions, and yeve hem strengthe and comfort of the Holy Gost. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.head: 17: The Marriage at Cana
div.ab: Jhesu ful of alle vertues, I thanke and magnifie yow that ye at the preiere of youre gloriouse modir [fol. 13r] turnid watir to wyn.N O goode lord, for that lady love betwene whose preciouse sides fourty wikesG ye lay, and aftir youre birthe ful tendirli kept yow and nurschedeG yow and fedde yow with swete mylke, graunte me continually youre grace and turne my vices in to vertues. O blisful Jhesu, for youre endeles mercy stableG my mende in al goodnesse and festeneG my herte to yow and make me evere to liven rithfulli aftir youre wil and plesing. Pater noster. Ave Maria gratia.

div.head: 18: The Baptism
div.ab: Benigne Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow for youre holy baptemeN that ye were baptisid of [fol. 13v] Seint Johnn in the water of flome Jordan.G A! good lord Jhesu, there the Holi Gost with hevenli lithG alihted on yow,N and the voys of God the fadir seide to yow:N “Thow art my dere sone of whom I am wel apaied.”G O mihtful God, the bapteme of youre holy sone: restore oure bapteme that we have thorw sinne brokin. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.head: 19: The Temptation
div.ab: Merciful Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow for the grete fastinges that ye fourti daies fastid.N And also I yelde yow thankinges, swete Jhesu, that opeG the time of yowre abstinence ye suffrede the fend to tempte yow whan ye [fol. 14r] were solitarie in desert,N in comfort of us that been temptid. O goode lord, have pité and compassion on hem alle that wilfulli for youre love beith solitarie: ancres, reclusis, and hermites, and alle estatis reclusid.G Fulfille hem with perfiyth grace that thei may levenG vertuousli, and yeve hem myht and strengthe to wistonde alle temptacions of the flesch, of the world, and of the feend.N Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.head: 20: The Penance of Jesus
div.ab: Gloriouse Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow for alle your grete wakinges, and for alle the grete hunger, thurst, and cold and hard lyynges, and bare foot goingesN that [fol. 14v] ye, debonere Jhesu, in this wepyng valeieN nyht and day suffrid. A! lord Jhesu, what nede hadde ye that were so pure and good to doon penaunce? Sothli ye nedid not as for yow self, for ye agiltG nevere for which ye schulden don ony penaunce. But love only constreinyd yow to doon it for oure nede and helthe, for elles we hadde not be sufficient to don penaunce as we for oure sinnes deserve. Also merciful Jhesu, ye dede it to exiteG us to do the same, for ye yafG us emsaumpleG to doon penaunce for your love as ye deden for oure.

Penaunce is to us ful profitable and gretli plesith yow, [fol. 15r] for holy writ seith that hevene aprochith to the penitentis.N Penaunce with preiere and contricion is weyeG and ledereG N to gete us grace of yow and foryenesseG of oure sinnes. Penaunce discreteliG doon is oure sacrifise to yow for oure misdedis, and be youre mercyful goodnesse it clensith us of oure sinnes and relesith us of grete peynes that we schulde have in purgatorie,N and so the sonere to be with you in everlasting blisse. O Holi Trinité, sithin that penaunce is so plesing to yow and is weieG T and meeneG to bringe us to youre love, make me to do penaunce so that I may thorw [fol. 15v] youre grace make dewe satisfaction for my sinnes with preiere, penaunce, and contricion and with alle other goode dedis profithG groundid in yow. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.head: 21: The Manners and Gaze of the Lord
div.ab: Gracious Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow for alle your holi maneres, cheres, cuntenaunces,G and for alle youre graciouses lokynges of youre pitable yen.G I yelde yow thankynges with myn poure herte. O myhtful Trinité, governe ever more myne maneres, cheres, cuntenaunces, and myn yen syghteG so that it be alwey meke, devout and benigne, and yeve me grace, glorious God, so [fol. 16r] deepli to wade vertuousli in youre swete love that ye be continualy in myn thowgthG and I therwith evere to be glad withoutyn dissolucion,G and sobreG withoute hevynesse.G Pater noster. Ave.

div.note: yen syghte, eyesight

div.head: 22: The Samaritan Woman at the Well
div.ab: O Jhesu ful of benignité, I yelde yow thankynges that ye so meke and mildeli spak a good while with the woman Samaritan that come to the welleN therG ye sat to fetche watyr. And ye, benigne Jhesu, bad here yeve yow drinke and seide to here, whoG that drank of the water of lif that ye yevin that thei schulde not thurstyn perpetueli; for the watir, ye seiden, is the welle that hem schal lede to everlastyng lif. [fol. 16v] And thus fulhomliG ye spak with here a good while and told here her privé secrees.G N O good lord, come in to my soule, tel and schew me the derkhedG of defauteT that priveli lurkyn withinne me, suffre me not to make of vertu vice ne of vice vertu, voideG fro me alle evil custumes and yeve me cler syht of trewe undirstonding and sothfastG knowinge so that I may fully amende me of alle myne defautes. A! gracious Jhesu, graunte me also the water of lif that I thurste not endelesli, and make me drunke in youre swete love wherthorwG I may at the laste come to ever|lasting [fol. 17r] lif. Amen. Pater noster. Ave.

div.head: 23: The Sermon on the Mount
div.ab: Blisful Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow for alle youre holy sermones, and also that ye baptised the pepil,N and for ye chese youre twelve apostelesN and namid hem aposteles. And at that tyme, swete Jhesu, ye deliverede hem the comaundementis of the newe lawe,N and not be maner of distresseG or manas,G but be maner of beheste.G And also, benigne Jhesu, I yelde yow thankinges for the eiyte blessingesG that ye than yaf and seide in this wise: “Blissid be the pouere spirituels:G for the kyngdom of hevene is heres.N Blissid be the debonaires:G [fol. 17v] for thei schal have lond — that is to saye, everlesting lif. Blissid be thei that wepin: for thei schuln be comfortid. Blissid be thei that desiren rithwisnesseG as mete and drinke: for thei schal be fulfillid. Blissid be the merciables:G for thei schal have mercy. Blissid be thei that have clene hertis: for thei schul se God. Blissid be thei that been pesible:G for their schul been clepid Godis sones. Blessid be thei that suffrin persecucion for rithwisnes: for the reumeG of God is heris.” O goode lord, chese me and name me for onG of youre chosin children, and graunte me these heye vertues [fol. 18r] wherthorw I may, Jhesu, yow plesin; and yeve me grace day and nyht evere to be yowre trewe servant withoutyn variaunce.G Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.note: eiyte blessinges, eight beatitudes
pouere spirituales, poor in spirit

div.head: 24: The Conversion of Mary Magdalene
div.ab: Jhesu ful of debonerté,G I thanke and magnifie yow that ye clepid and receyvid the seventi and two disciples,N and for ye healede the pepileN of ydropesiesG and palsiesN and of rennyng blod.N And speciali I yeve yow thankinges that ye, benigne Jhesu, suffrede Marie Maudeleyne whan sche was holde so sinful that sche hadde seven fendisG withinne hereN to aproche to youre holy feet in the hous of the Phariseye, and ther [fol. 18v] sche wepte for here misdedis and wessch youre feetN with here terys,G and wipid hem with here heer. Also I thanke yow, gode lord, that ye mercyfulli foryaf here alle her sinnes. O dereworthi Jhesu, suffre me thowgh I be wikkid, werst of alle othire, to aprochin to youre holy feet, and yeve me grace there to abide and wepe for my grete misdedis, til youre merciful herte foryeve me alle min sinnes.T Pater noster. Ave Maria.

note.gloss: edema (painful swelling of the limbs caused by fluid retention)

div.head: 25: Jesus and Mary Magdalene
div.ab: I thanke and magnifie yow, Jhesu ful of grace, that ye have no despitG ne indignacion of the sinful that wele forsake here sinnes, but in gret chareté [fol. 19r] ye receyve hem to youre grace. O lord of pureté and of clennesse, ye arn not skeymousG of hem thowgh thei have been fowle and al defacidG thorw sinnes, but anoonG as thei been contrit ye make hem fair and brith,G and famuliarliG in hem ther make youre habitacion. O lord, gret is your bounté, blissid and preisid, thankid and heried,G glorified and magnified be ye evere therfore. Also swete Jhesu, I yelde yow thankinges that ye so debonerli excused Marie Maudeleyne thriesN there to the Phariseies whan she wepteT at youre feet. Anothir time ye, meke Jhesu, excusid here what [fol. 19v] tyme here sustir Martha compleinid to yow that sche wolden not helpyn here. Ful graciousli ye seiden thanne to Martha that Marie hadde chosin the betir partye,N which schulde nevere be benomynG here. The thridde tyme, benigne Jhesu, ye excusid hereN whan Judas grucchidG the precious oynement that sche spendid on yow.

O gode lord, yeve me grace to have perfith charité to alle myn even CristenG N and schildeG me that I nevere have despit ne disdein of hem for senne but love the persones and hate the sinne.N O charitable God, make me to folwe youre pureté and youre vertues. [fol. 20r] Jhesu myn joye and myn comfort, myn hope and al myn hele,G fulfille me with your goodnesse and sadli stable me therinne. Jhesu myn strengthe and myn socour, schilde me from alle bodili and gostli periles. And gracious lord, for the gret pité and mercy that ye hadde of Marie Maudeleyne and also for the gret love that sche hadde to yow here in erthe and hath now in hevene, blissid Trinité, be holde me with youre pitable yen and graunte me yowre love.

O allas, I sinful, how dar I thus holi spekin with my lord God that with his myht hevene and erthe made and alle thing of nowht?G Certeinli I, sinful [fol. 20v] wreche, am not worthi to speke to hym, ne to hevynG up myn eyn to hevene, but as a sinful wormN down to the erthe, as sche that is not worthi to preise God, ne to nemineG his name, for the profithG seith the preising of God is not fair in a sinful mouth.N O merciful lord, Holi Trinité: mercy, mercy. My sinnes putten me often tymes abake so that I dar not spekyn ne come in to youre presence, but youre mercy which hath no ende ne noumbre drawith me alwey forth and makith me to been homli and familier with yow; wherfore benigne God, I yelde yow thankinge, [fol. 21r] and thankid be ye as often as alle hertis can or may devise. And myhtful lord, I beseche yow: sithin I am not worthi to preise yow, make me worthi and able therto, and youre owyn goodnesse preise, blisse and magnifie yow in me, so that what evere I write, thinke or speke of yow and for yow, be it youre werk and not myn. And seie to me, and to alle that have forsake the world for yow,N as ye seide to Martha of Maudeleyne, that we have chose the betir partye that nevere schal be benomynG us. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.note: even Cristen, fellow Christians
of nowht, out of nothing

div.head: 26: Feeding the Multitudes
div.ab: Myhtful Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow that ye fedde the foure thouzande pepleN and moG [fol. 21v] with five looves and toG fisschis so plenteuousli that thei lefte twelve beer-lepisG ful of relefG whan thei hadde etyn. Anothir tyme, goode lord, ye fedde a gret multitude of peple with seven looves and with lityl fissch;N wherfore I yelde yow thankinges, blissid and worchepid moteG ye evere ben. O Holi Trinité, ful of myht and mercy, in whom is al plenté and largenesseG with youre swete love and gostli virtues and joyes in yow, fede and nurische my nedy soule that is ful ofte hungry and disolat, bare and nakid of gostli godes. A! lord, have pité on my povert and on my gret nede.

Mercy|fulT [fol. 22r] God, ye knowen wel as be rithG to the most poure the almesse muste be doon and ye, goode lord, mowin do no wrong. And therfore as be rith, ye muste nedis yeve it me that am the moste poure of gostli fruytesN and moste nede have and hungir. Jhesu, fede me with youre presence, fulfille me al of yow, for of lesse may not myn povert passe.G Jhesu God and man, arraie me with youre graciousce vertues and yveG me yow in al: than have I al that I desire and al that me nedith. O allas goode lord, what have I seide? I aske to have youre almasseG of grace and yow be rithG of my povert, [fol. 22v] and how dar I do so? I, that am a wikkid worm, a stinking careyne,G a sinful caytif,G a wretchid sinnere ful of felonie. O mercyful lord, more is in me than myn gret povert of wanting of youre grace and vertues. Ther is in me gret multitude of sinne and wretchidnes that first muste be voidid orG than I may atteyne to so heye a yefte;G for lord, ye arn al pureté and al goodnesse, and I am al filtheN and al wikkidnesse, and how mihte thise two contrariousG dwelle togider?G But gracious lord, this onli comfortith me, that youre myht and mercy may in a moment of tyme clense me of [fol. 23r] al filthe of sinne and foryeve me alle offensis; it is youre rith to be merciful of sinners. Therfore glorious lord, be wey of rith of youre vertues I crave, and aske to have youre mercy and grace, and than also to have yow in al clennesse and pureté in me. Dere God, graunte it me for youre grete benignité. Pater noster. Ave.

div.note: be rith, by rights
for of lesse may not myn povert passe, since my poverty will not pass for any less
be rith, on account of

div.head: 27: Calming the Storm
div.ab: Gracious Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow for alle the windes and tempestesN that ye, swete Jhesu, apesedinG and cecedinG divers times, whan youre aposteles werin apointG in the see to plunge. O goode lord, kepe me whiles I am in [fol. 23v] this world, that weel may be likinid to the see, ful of noyous wawis,G and my sinful body to a boot,G my soule therinne travailid with perilous tempestis. A! debonere Jhesu, save me as ye savedin Petir in the watir from drinchingG that I plonge not ne perissche thorwe my malice in this trobliG watir of tribulacions and temptacions. O dere lord, comforte me with youre voies and seie to me “Noli timere,”G N and lede my soule in saftee til it come to that glorious hevene ther is everlasting sekirnes,G joye, blisse and reste. Pater noster qui es in.G Ave Maria.

div.note: werin apoint, were about
noyous wawis, hazardous waves
Noli timere, “Do not be afraid”
Pater noster qui es in, Our Father who is in, i.e., the first five words of the Lord’s Prayer

div.head: 28: The Mocking of Jesus
div.ab: [fol. 24r] Gracious Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow for alle the skornis, despites, schames,N wronges and reproves that ye in this world suffred. And I yelde yow thankinges, swete Jhesu, that ye ful charitabli excusid yowre aposteles whan the Phariseyes reprovid hem and accusid hem.T Ones was what tyme thei tokin the eeres of the wheteN as thei wente be the wey and affrayedG it in here handes and etyn the greynesG on a day of Sabat.G Anothir time ye, meke Jhesu, excusid hem whan the Phariseyes accusid hem and pleinid to yow that thei wente to mete with [fol. 24v] unwasshin handes.N O goode lord, God have pité and compassion on youre servauntis of holi chirche, for many enemys, accusers and deniersN thei have now in these dayes. But benigne Jhesu, excuse hem to youre holi fadir of hevene of here defautes, and yeve hem grace mekli to suffren schame, skornys, despitis,G wronges and repreves when it comith to hem pureli for the love of yow. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.head: 29: The Woman Taken in Adultery
div.ab: Blisful Jhesu, I thanke and magnifieT yow for the myht and mercy that ye schewedin to the woman that was foundin in avow|trie,G N [fol. 25r] whan the maistir of the Phariseyes browten here to yow and askid what thei schulden doon with here. For thei seiden that Moises hadde comoundidN that swich sheG schulde been stonid. And this thei dede for yefG ye hadde seide stone here, thei schulde have askriedG yow for cruel, for the pepil that helde yow so pitousG schulde have loved yow the lesse; and yef ye hadde seide let here go quyt,G thei to have take yow as him that hadde doon ayens Moyses lawis. But ye, meke Jhesu, that knewe al here malice wrowhte al anothir,G and whanne ye saw the woman [fol. 25v] come ye enclinid and lokid doun, and wrot in the erthe for the woman schulde not be aschamid. Ye savid here also that day fro deth. A! gentil lord ful of curtesie, I yelde yow thankinges for this dede that ye, meke Jhesu, of youre gret benignité deede.

And thei than fersli askid yow what thei schulde doo with the woman, and ye fersli lokid on hem and bad which of hem that was withoutyn sinne schulde castin on here the first ston. And forth rihtG ye enclinid to the erthe anothir tyme and wrot in the erthe, and everich of hem saw there here owin sinnes,N [fol. 26r] and for schame anoon they stal awaei be on and on,G til ther was never on in that place but ye and the woman. And thanne ful debonerli ye seide to here: “woman where been thei that accusid thee, dampnidG thee noman.” “Noo lord,” quod sche, “noman.” And than ye, mercyable God, seide to here that ye wolde not dampne here, and bad here go and welneG to sinne nomore. O goode lord, I preye yow that alle thoo that hatin and despisen folkis of holi chirche, and beth glad to finde hem with defautes, writ in the ground of here hertis,N and opne the eye of here soules that thei may here owyn [fol. 26v] sinnes and defautes see,T that thei may be aschamid of here pride and, goode lord, yeve hem grace to have verray contricion of alle here sinnes and to amende hem of here misdedis. Pater noster. Ave Maria gratia.

div.note: swich she, such as she
wrowhte al anothir, did something completely different
forth rith, right away
be on and on, one by one

div.head: 30: The Woman of Canaan’s Daughter
div.ab: I thanke and magnifie yow, Jhesu ful of grace, that ye chasid the fendis awey and legions of fendesN fro men and women. And speciali I yelde yow thankinges for the womanes douyter of Cananee,N that ye chasid the fend from here at the preyng of here modir. O lord, mercyable Jhesu, but first ye made daungerG whan ye seide to here that it [fol. 27r] was not lefulG to take the bred that was ordeynyd to the children and yeven it to the houndes, and sche answerde: “lord, noo, but houndes may ete the crummes that fallin doun from the lordis bordG out of children handes.” A! benigne Jhesu, it plesid yow ful mechilG the meke answere of this woman, which made yow ful myldeli to saye: “O woman, mochil is thi feith; be it as thow witt.”G N

A dere Jhesu, therfore ye made so straungeG atte beginnyng of here preiere for sche schulde gete here the more medeG and thanke of yow, and also yeve us exsaumple that we schulde mekli abide in preiere though firste we finde straunge|ness [fol. 27v] and have not oure preieres anoonG whan we wolde.G For your bounté wele not werneG us oure preieres, and it be skilfulliG askid yef we abide mekeli therupon. O mercyful Trinité, thowgh I be most unworthi and am an hound thorw bestli condicions, and werse than an hound as in ther that I have wrethedG yow, yet goode lord I preie yow yeve me crumes of youre mercy and grace and the bred of everlasting life, and make me with al feith and mekenesse continualli to abide in preiere, that myne preieres mowynG been herd and grauntid of yow, as was [fol. 28r] the womanes of Cananee. Pater noster.

div.note: ful mechil, very much

div.head: 31: The Transfiguration
div.ab: Benigne Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow for youre gloriouse TransfiguracionN which was a blisful sight ful of swetnesse, whan youre gracious face schon wiht as the sunne and youre clothing wexG whit as snow;N and there Moyses and Helie aperid and spak to yow. A! Petir,N this sight was ful plesing to yow. Ye taasted a litil of this hevenli joye and made yow desiren there to have dwellid, whane ye seide to oure lord: “Sire, it is good here to abide; yef ye welin,G we schal make here thre tabernacles, on for [fol. 28v] yow, anothir for Moyses, the thridde for Helie.” O dere Jhesu, but ye ches rather to suffre for oure redempcion peynes and deth than for to abide there or in youre kingdom of blisse til ye hadde bowthG us with youre precious blod, and therfore I yelde yow thankinges. Swete Jhesu, blissid and worchepid, glorified and magnified be ye evere therfore. And whiles ye spak with Moyses and with Helie a brith cloude come and sprad yow, and a voyes of God youre fadir cam fro the cloude and seide: “This is my dere sone,N of whom I am weel plesid — herith him.” O I preie [fol. 29r] yow, goode lord, that thus were transfigurid, transforme my soule out of worldli lust and joye in gostli merthe and meledieN of yow, in yow, for yow, and make me here your vois and wordes, and wel to folwe ther aftir that I be alwey to yow redi and attendaunt. Pater noster.

div.head: 32: The Raising of Lazarus
div.ab: Jhesu, ful of grace, I thanke and magnifie yow for alle youre holi preieris that ye have preied to your fadir of hevene to yeven us exsample to preie, and for al the speche that ye spak on erthe. And also I yelde yow thankinges, swete benigne Jhesu, that ye rered Lazar [fol. 29v] fro deth to live, that foure dayes hadde leyenN in the monument. And othir two also ye rerid to live afore that tyme, the princes dowter JayreN and the wedewisG soneN that was bornG ded on bere,G wherfore I yelde yow thankinges. O dere lord, youre holi preieres excite me alwei to preieres, and schilde me from evil,N T deth and dedli sinne. And arereG my soule awey in to contemplacion, where that I may undirstonde, beholde, see, and fele youre swetnes and youre secres.G Pater noster. Ave.

div.head: 33: The Entry into Jerusalem
div.ab: I thanke and magnifie yow Jhesu, ful of blisse, for youre riding [fol. 30r] on Palme Soneday upon the asse and here fole to the Citee of Jerusalem; and then it was fulfillid the prophecie that seit: “Noli timere filia Syon ecce rex tuus venit super pullum asinii.”G N A! swete Jhesu, the peple dede yow gret worchip that day, and comyn ayenstG yow with gret processions, and leyde here clothis and palme brounchis and brounchis of olive and the weye undir the asses feet that ye, meke Jhesu, sat upon. And thei sungen songes of worschip and herryngG to yow, and as ye wittenessin yow self, but yif thei hadden don soG the stones schulden [fol. 30v] have cried.N O lord, mechilG is youre myht. Iblissid be ye, and worchepid in alle youre miyhtful werkis. Benigne Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow also for the gret pité and compassion that ye hadden for the destruxion of that cité, for which ful tendreli ye weptin.N O ye tendre hertid lord, ful of pité and compassion, that wepte so longe afore er than it fel, for Jersalem schulde been destroid speciali for sinne that schulde cause that destruccion.N A! goode Jhesu, verray god and man: have pité and compassion of al holi cherche which is youre spouse, and suffre it not to been [fol. 31r] destroied but, merciful Trinité, amende hemG of here sinnes and governe hem in al grace and vertues, and alwei save hem and supporte hem in alle tymes of nede, to youre everlasting glorie and magnifiyng. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.note: Noli timere filia Syon ecce rex tuus venit super pullum asinii, “Fear not, daughter of Sion: behold, thy king cometh, sitting on an ass’s colt”
but yif thei hadden don so, if they had not done so

div.head: 34: The Cleansing of the Temple
div.ab: Gracious Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow, that ye divers times chacid out of the templeN the beyeres and the selleres, principalli on Palme Soneday. Ye beet hem and drof hem owt of the temple for the gret jelosieG N that ye haddynT of youre fadris hows.N Also I yelde yow thankinges, swete Jhesu, that ye wolde been worchepid of innocent children [fol. 31v] which sungen before yow: “Osanna filio David benedictus qui venit in nomine domini rex israel.”G N And there thei fulfillid the prophecie that David seide in the sauter, “Ex ore infantium et lactentium perfecisti.”G N O goodeG us alle that ye han chosin to be youre temple, chase from us pride, coveitise and alle sinnes, and gadreG alle oure wittes togedir from alle worldliT vanitees and vein beholdinges, and stable it sadliG in the mende of yow, and yeve us grace continuali to do worchepe and reverence to yow, as we owin to doon. And make oure soule, bodi, and herte alwei clene [fol. 32r] and able it to been youre temple, fulfille it in alle vertues that ye may reste fully and dwelle in us, and we in yow, Jhesu ful of bounté. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.note: Osanna filio David benedictus qui venit in nomine domini rex israel, “Hosanna to the son of David, blessed is he that cometh in the name of the Lord, the king of Israel”
Ex ore infantium et lactentium perfecisti, “Out of the mouth of infants and of sucklings thou hast perfected praise”
stable it sadli, fix it firmly

div.head: 35: The Tears of the Lord
div.ab: Jhesu ful of comfort, I thanke and magnifie yow for alle youre exercises,G and for alle the teresN that ye fro youre blissid eyen let falle in this woful valeye, and also for alle the steppis of youre holi feetN I yelde yow thankinges. O goode lord, youre holi exercises withdrawe me from alle wikkidnes, and stereG me alwey to al good, and youre holi teres scarifieG oure teres, and youre gracious [fol. 32v] vertues and steppis lede us continuali the riht wey to yow, God ful of myht and mercy. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

note.gloss: let blood as a medical treatment

div.head: 36: The Last Supper
div.ab: I thanke and magnifie yow, Jhesu ful of glorie, for the maundeG that ye madin on Scher ThorusdayN amoyng youre apostelis, at the which maunde ye schewedin us gret ensample of mekenes that ye so mekely whesch here feet.N Also ye yaf gret ensaumple of charité at that soper that ye, benigne Jhesu, so famulierli eet with hem, and charitabli tauyt hem and comfortid hem, O goode lord, and fedde hem with youre precious body . . .T

note.gloss: the ceremonial washing of the disciples’ feet

div.head: 37: The Procession to Calvary
div.ab: [fol. 33r] . . . nifie yow,T that ye baar the hevy crosN up on youre sore brousid schuldrenG and woundid body. A! lord, sumtyme the cros betokenith penaunce, and sumtyme it signifieth contemplacion. O, goode God, yeve grace that I may helpeN to bere youre cros, that is to say mekli to bere for your love alle hevy birthenys of charge that fallith to me, also to doon penaunce for the love of yow, as ye dede for me, and graunte me grace, blisful God, to been contemplatif as my degre askyth.G Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.note: brousid schuldren, bruised shoulders
degre askyth, vocation requires

div.head: 38: Saint Veronica
div.ab: Benigne Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow for the [fol. 33v] prente of youre holi face that ye made to the woman Veronica,N whiles Simon of SirenN was maad to berith the cros that ye bar. And that prente whiche is clepid the vernicle ye yaf us as for a love tokeneN to havyn youre blissid visage in remembraunce. O goode lord, ful of benignité, yeve me grace continueli to havyn youre gracious visage and youre passion in mende, considering the swete love and bounté that ye have doon for me, and for al mankende. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.head: 39: The Crucifixion
div.ab: Rihtful Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow for the gret peine [fol. 34r] that ye, meke Jhesu, suffrid at that time that youre clothis werin doon off, whan ye schulde been crucified. O goode lord, youre clothis clevidG N to youre gracious body, for the blood of youre precious wowndes was dried and congelid therto, and therfore in the takinge awey it reredG off bothe skin and flessh of youre blissid bak and sides. A! debonor Jhesu, than thei leide yow to the cros and bownde yow theron and with cordes thei drowenG youre hondesN and feet to the holes of the cros, and nailid hem therto with grete ruggidG nailes.N O Jhesu lord, ful of [fol. 34v] al goodnesse, that were thus peinefulli festnid to the cros for love of mankende: have mercy and pité on al youre peple that ye have bowthG so dere, and raceG from us al wikkidnesse, and knytte us so faste to yow with a love knotteN that the knot be nevere onknyt, ne we fro yow disseverid. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.head: 40: Jesus’s Suffering on the Cross
div.ab: Merciful Jhesu, thanked and magnified be ye for that grete peine that ye, my lord, suffrid whan the cros fel with youre blissid body,N for it was not set sufficientli in the morteyses.G And thanne alle the cruel Jewis that werin there heven [fol. 35r] yow up ayen, ye and the cros nailid faste togedir, and putten the foot of the cros ayens in the morteys so despitousli and cruely that it stoneyde, lusschede, and buschedeG al youre body, and with that bresureG alle the veynis and senwes of youre blissid body to brusten,G and youre precious woundes bleddin gret foyson.G O myn herte, whi ne clevist on tweyneG for pité of thin lord, that alle thiseT cruel turmentis hadde? O, treuli I may seie that my herte is more hard than is the hard ston,N for stones, lord, at youre deth to bursten and clevedin on tweine. Allas, I sinful [fol. 35v] this is a foul schame to me that I am more boystousG and hard to my lord God than is the ston. O benigne God, softeG my herte with youre dere love: sende to me a sparkle of the Holi Gost and anoynte my hard herte with the precious licour of youre swete blood so that love, pité, and compassion may ever abide in me.

A swete Jhesu, the aking of youre sides and the gret thurst and drinesseN that ye hadde for lac of blod that was fro yow ronnenG reundG yow also ful sori. O good lord, that al this woo suffrid for me: what schal I do ayenG [fol. 36r] for yow? Nowht but love ye aske of me, for alle youre woful peynes and grevouse travailes. O allas, myn wretched herte, whi art thow so rude and unkende?G Whi takist thou not this deepli and langourist for love? O Jhesu king of love, make me youre love to fele, and graunte me grace to love yow with al my myht, with al myn herte, and with al myn soule. And goode lorde, reule continuali myne thouytes and dedes aftir youre wil and plesing. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

note.gloss: mortises, sockets, or grooves used in carpentry to fix one piece of wood to another

div.note: stoneyde, lusschede, and buschede, stunned, dashed, and shoved
to brusten, burst
whi ne clevist on tweyne, why [do you] not split in two

div.head: 41: Jesus’s Words on the Cross
div.ab: Glorious Jhesu, I thanke and [fol. 36v] magnifie yow, for alle the wordes that ye spak here on erthe, and speciali I yelde yow thankinges for alle the wordes that ye, swete Jhesu, spak whiles ye heng on the cros.N O lord, kepe myn tunge from wikkid wordes and from alle thoo wordes that myhte hindrenG or sowneG in to evil that I displese yow nowht with my tunge but make me for youre benignité alwei to saye swich wordes as most may be to youre worchepe plesing and heriyng,G and to my even Cristen soules profiting. A! goode Jhesu, the eyselG and the [fol. 37r] galleG N was put to youre mouth: lord, kepe myn mouth fro glotenie of mete and drinke, and yeve me grace to abstene me from alle spyces of sinne. Pater noster.

div.head: 42: The Thirst of the Lord
div.ab: Blisful Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow for the grete desir that ye hadden to manes soule whan ye, debonere Jhesu, seiden: “Sicio.”G N Ye desired thanne ful gretli to have manes soule owt of the fendes pousté,G and fro the derknes that thei were in. For ye hadd raunsomyd hemT with that precious tresor which was blod and life. O goode [fol. 37v] lord, leed my soule from derknesse of sinne, and make me to desire with love longinge to have yow alwey in myn herte, O Holi Trinité, and with al mekenesse and reverence stedfastli myn mynde in yow, with holy thouytes and goode ententes, and stable vertues in me. Pater noster. Ave.

div.note: Sicio, “I thirst”

div.head: 43: The Harrowing of Hell
div.ab: Gracious Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow: blissid and worchepid be ye evirmore for your peineful deth, which desseverid your holy soule fro youre blissid body whan ye seiden “Consummatum est.”G N A! goode Jhesu, thanne youre precious soule with the godhed descendid to [fol. 38r] helleN and took owt Adam and Eve, and alle youre frendes that there werin, and browt hem to paradyse. O merciful dere lord, have pité and yeve mercy to alle the soules that been in the peynes of purgatorie and on hem alle that youre mercy abiden.G Speciali I beseche yow, myn gracious lord God, for al myn kin and frendes that been owt of this world passid: myn fadir and myn modir, myn godfadir and god modres, myn bretherin, myn sustren, and for myne gostli fadres that I have been confessid to. And swete Jhesu, I preie yow for alle my|ne [fol. 38v] goode doeres that been deede, the which I have been sustenid and fortheridG by, also alle thoo that evere I hadde of comfort or ese, bodili or gostli. O myn soverein lord myhtful Trinité, graunte hem alle comfort and relesG of peynes, and bringe hem to that blisse the which is alwey enduring. Amen. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.note: Consummatum est, “it is fulfilled” (“it is done”)

div.head: 44: Saint Longinus
div.ab: Debonere Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow for that precious wounde that LongeusN made with a scharp spere, and persid to youre holi blissid herte, and fro that wownde ran watir and blood. O dereworthiG [fol. 39r] lord Jhesu, that precious blood and water clense the blindnesse of myn gostli eyen and herte, as it dede the eyen of Longeus, wher thorw he gat his sight and myhte weel seen, so that I may haveT verray knowing of youre divine bounté and trewe sight, and knowing of my self and of alle my sinnes and defautes with perfith hope of youre mercy. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.head: 45: The Deposition
div.ab: I thanke and magnifie yow, Jhesu ful of benignité, for alle youre miracleful werkes and gracious dedes, and in reverence and remembraunce of hem, and for alle wowndes [fol. 39v] of youre precious body and woful peynes that ye, blissid Jhesu, for oure love suffrid, and were take doun off the cros and leyde in sepulcre. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.head: 46: The Entombment
div.ab: A! ladi seynte Marie, myn lordis dere modir, I preie yow glorious virgine, and also seint John the wangelist, and Marie Maudeleyne, Joseph of Armathe and Nichodeme,N and al that holi cumpanieT that was at that holi beriyngG of my lordes precious body, Crist Jhesu. I prey yow alle preiyeth for me to that holi God Jhesu that he take myn herte from al ertheliG [fol. 40r] thing and berie and close it spiritualiT in him as his blissid body was beriedN in the sepulcre. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.head: 47: The Appearance to the Virgin Mary
div.ab: Blisful Jhesu, I thanke yow and blissid be ye of yow self. Worchepid and magnified be ye everemore of alle creaturis for youre glorious resurreccion that ye, goode lord, aroos myhtiliT from deth to lif on Ester day, and aperid to youre dere modir,N and seide to here: “Salve sancta parens.”G N O lady, for that gret joye that ye hadde whan ye saw youre dere worthi sone from deth to live arisen, and for the goodli daliaunceN [fol. 40v] that was thanne betwen yow bothe, O gloriouse virgine, and for the fervent love that youre blissid herte was with inflamind in his blisful presence: preie my lord the Trinité that in alle vertues and rihtful levyng he yeve me grace to have good perseveraunce in to myn lyves ende. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.note: Salve sancta parens, “Hail, holy mother”

div.head: 48: The Appearance to Mary Magdalene
div.ab: Benigne Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow that ye apperid also the day of youre Resurreccion to Marie Maudeleyne,N which is a gret comfort to sinners. O lady Maudeleyne, for the gret joye that ye haddeN thanne of his glorious [fol. 41r] Resurreccion, of his presence and of his speche, whom ye loved so inwardli: preie myn lord Jhesu that mercifulli foryaf youre sinnes whan ye wepte at his feet that he for his gret goodnes foryeve me alle myne sinnes and make me evere to loven him parfithli.G Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.head: 49: The Supper at Emmaus
div.ab: Jhesu ful of endeles goodnes, I thanke and magnifie yow for the appering that ye apperid to CleophasN and his felawe on EsterneT Moneday. And ful benigneli, goode lord, ye walkid with hem and brouht hem owt of here errour and wente with hem in to the Castell of [fol. 41v] Emaus,N and there ye sattin at a bord betwen hem two and brak the bred wher thorw thei knewyn yow. O benigne Jhesu, blissid and worchepid, glorified and magnified be ye evere more for alle the comfortis that thee have doon and schal doon in to the day of Jugement to youre chosin children. Pater noster. Ave.

div.head: 50: The Incredulity of Thomas
div.ab: Merciful Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow for alle the apperinges that thee apperid aftir yowre Resurreccion. And specialli I thanke yow, good lord, for youre appering to seynt ThomasN of Inde, at the which tyme ye yaf [fol. 42r] youre blissing to alle hem that belevyd in yow and never saw yow. O dere benigne God, yeve us alle grace feithfulli and continualli to have parfith beleeve in yow wherthorw we may have youre blissing evir withoutyn ende. Amen. Pater noster. Ave.

div.head: 51: The Ascension
div.ab: Myhtful Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow for youre merveilous Ascension,N that ye steyG to hevene on holi ThursdayT and sette yow on youre fadris rihtT hand, and schul come ayen and deme the quikeG and the dede.N O gracious lord, graunte me grace thanne to been on youre riht side and [fol. 42v] seie to me with youre children: “Venite benedicti Patris mei, possidete paratum vobis regnum a constitutioneT mundi,”G N that I may at that time beG youre blisful bounté haven part of youre eritage, ever to love and herie yow in blisse evirlesting. Amen. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.note: deme the quike, judge the living
Venite benedicti Patris mei, possidete paratum vobis regnum a constitutione mundi, “Come, ye blessed of my Father, possess you the kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world”

div.head: 52: Pentecost
div.ab: Glorious Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow for the sending doun of the Holi GostN to youre apostelis on Witsunday, which fulfilde with wit and wisdomN and yaf hem strengthe to suffre for youre dere love peynes and turmentis and cruel deth. O blisful lord, ful of [fol. 43r] swetnesse and ful of all bounté: sende us youre Holi Gost to fulfille us with wit and wisdom, where thorw we mowe wisli governe oure self as longe as the lif is withinne oure bodies, and also to yeven us strengthe, mekeli and myghtili, to suffren peynes and disseses for youre love and to with-stonde alle vices and neverT to flitteG from yow for lif ne for deth. Pater noster. Ave Maria gratia.

div.head: 53: The Sacred Heart
div.ab: A debonere Jhesu, I thanke and magnifie yow: worchepid and blissed be ye, goode lord, continueli in alle youre gracious vertues, and blissid and worchepid [fol. 43v] been alle youre holy lymesG and fetures, and alle youre bones and alle youre intrailes. And speciali I thanke and magnifie youre precious merciful herte.N O blisful dere herte of myn lord Jhesu God: from yow comyth the brith schinyng bemes of deepe lyht of trewe understondyng. O gracious herte, from yow comyth the cler knowyng and stremys of swetnesse, the whiche is joye and comforth to oure mornyngG soules. O benigne herte, that was so meke and pacient to suffre alle wornges,G peynes and disseses that was put to yow: [fol. 44r] blissid and thankid mote ye be. O merciful herte, ful of al godnes in whom is al precious gostli oynementisG N to hele with oure sike soules. O herte debonere, from yow comyth al grace and vertues that is yeven to man and woman: glorified and magnified be ye evermore. O swete herte, ful of love: wownde myn herte in youre love and ravissche itN al in yow. Schewe to me youre briht bemesG of gostli undirstonding and streme me youre watresN clere that gostli frutesT may growe in me, and alwey make me lowli to receiven youre spirituel sondesG and mekeli to resig|neG [fol. 44v] it to yow. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.head: 54: The Benefits of the Lord
div.ab: Mihtful Trinité, ful of endeles glorie, I thanke and magnifie yow for alle the beenfetis that ye han doon to al mankende. And speciali I thanke yow that ye, gracious God, of yowre hey noblesse voucheth safG to been so mercyful to me, sinful. I thanke yow, benigne lord, of alle the beenfetes that ye withoutyn noumbre have doon to me, not withstonding that I am an unworthi, vicious,G wrecchid creature. Yet I finde youre goodnesse ever redy to me: therfore I beseche youre modir Lady seynt Marie, and al the cumpany of hevene, [fol. 45r] to thanke yow for my sake. O Holi Trinité, in hevene and in erthe, blissid and loved, worchepid and thankid, glorified and magnified be ye, blissid lord, continueli that lyvest and regnist in too, thre, and on,G everlasting withouten ende. Amen. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.note: hey noblesse voucheth saf, exalted nobility consents
too, thre, and on, two, three, and one

div.head: The Author’s Epilogue
div.ab: Ithankid be oure lord, good sustir, now have I ende that ye desired. I have write alwey at the beginninges of these preyeres and meditations thankynges and hereynges to God, for we owyn ever to thanke God for alle the grete werkis that he hath doon for man, and for alle yeftes and graces that of his benigneT goodnesse [fol. 45v] to us yevith and sendith; and for alle gostli and bodili victories, for be his helpe and grace it is doon. And but yef we yeldeG thankinges to God for alle these before seide, we been unkende wherthorw we gretli displese him, as ye may pleinli se be emsample of king EzechieN that after a gret victorie that he hadde, he made no canticleG thanking God of his victorie; and therfore was God displesed and sente him to seinG be his propheteN that he schulde dien. Wherfore I counseile alwey that ye in al mekenesse and reverence thanke and herie God at alle tymes for his beenfetis.

Ferthermore, myn sustir, mo [fol. 46r] peynes I have wretin than I finde in the passion of the gospel, the whiche was be revelacion of God schewid to a religious persone.N Alle the evangelistes witnessinN weel in here writing that ther was more of oure lord Crist Jhesu than thei wretin of him, and therfore it may leeffuliG been seide or wretin thing that hath be schewid be Godes goodnesse, al though it be not in the gospel. Also I write in divers places “us” and “we” for ye schulde at swich places take youre even Cristen with yow in youre preieres, for whan we preie for us self it plesith God [fol. 46v] gretli that we take oure even Cristen with us. And treuli, sustir, yef we do so he of his gret goodnesse wole thanne here oure preiere the sonere.G

I have set yow in this writing of lesse prisG that I hope ye been in the syght of God, for this cause: for thoug a man or womman be never so good a lever,G and though thei have never so mochil grace of God, gostli and bodili, thei schulde alwey sette lestG of hem self, and holde hem self most sinful and lest worthe of alle othire. But summe ther beth that seyn that thei can not holden hem self most sinful of alle othire, for thei seye that othir [fol. 47r] han doon grete dedli sinnes that thei dede nevere. And to hem that sein so I answere: yef thei wolde opin the eye of sothfastnesse,G it were ful litil maystrieG to holden hem self most sinful of alle othir. For yef the most perfith liver that is this day on lyve,G and lest sinne hath doon, and he hadde standin in the same occasions that the most sinful man stood in, and therto he hadde had the same temptacions and that same disposicion, and the grace of God withdrawe from hym, he schulde have do as evil as he or worse. And therfore as of his owin propretéG he may holde [fol. 47v] him self as most sinful, for it is but only of Godes goodnesse that kepith him fro the periles that othir fallin in.

And also ther is anothir wey a man to holde him self as on of the most sinful, though he fele meche grace and vertu yoven to him, and is this: yef a man or woman for his holi levyng falle into pride beholding her vertues and goode dedis, and rejoyeth in hem self with pride, wenyngG that thei be not so sinful as other been, ne doo not thoo evel dedes that othir doon, and in this deliten in hem self, and fallen thus in pride and veinglorie,N [fol. 48r] wilfuli holding weel be him self, thei ben more dispisable in the siht of God than thei that have sinnid in gret owtward sinnes. For I likene hem to the Pharisé that oure lord spekith ofN in the gospel. The Pharisé thowhte and seide to God that he dede goode dedis and was not so sinful as the publican,G and in this he hadde pride and reyoiced in him self; and therfore he was refusid of God, and the sinful publican for his wekenesse and contricion was receyvedT to grace. LuciferN also he sinnid, not in owtward fleshchli sinnes which arn most abominable and repro|vable [fol. 48v] in the siht of man, but he sinnid in pride onli, which is most reprevableG in the siht of God: and therfore he that was so faire an aungel for his pride become the fowlest fend of helle. O, sithin that pride is so perilous that it fadith al gostli beutéG N and gretli displesith God, it owith mechel to ben hatid and enchewidG of every creature to be soore aferdG therof. God, yeve us grace evere to flee therfro: and I seye yow trewli what creature that wole hatin it and eschewen it, he must evere holde him self werst of alle othir, and so I hope that ye do. But yet I write this to remembreG bothe yow and othir [fol. 49r] therupon, and especiali to excite my self to have it weel in mynde. And I am sekirG who so holdith him self most sinful he hath neythirT skorn ne hatred ne disdein of noon of evyn Cristen for eny sinne that thei do or have doon, but thei have pité and compassion of hem and hate the sinnes and love the persones;N and so mekenesse — who that wole takin it — causith charité and al goodnesse.

And, sustir, bindithG not yow selfN to seye al ovir the preieres every day, but seye summe on oon day and summe on anothir day as ye have leyserG at tyme. And whoso that evir usith [fol. 49v] mechil to seie it schal finde therinne grace, comforth, and strengthe. I woldeG ye coudenG the sentence withoutyn the book, for andG ye so coude ye schulden fele mochil more comforth and unyon in God, to seye it so inforthG than for to seie it be scripture.N And farith now weel, myn goode sustir: God yeve us bothe grace in al thing to do as it is most to his worschep and plesing. Amen.

div.note: And but yef we yelde, And if we do not yield
